translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽In accordance with the True Idea, and the opposite of it,🔽The three-factored conditional relations, the text in the three-factored conditional relations,

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.49. Sanidassanattika, Hetusahetukaduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ hetuñceva sahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho🔽nahetu ceva naahetuko ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ sahetukañceva na ca hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika hetu sa hetuka duka  anidassana appaṭigham hetuñca iva sa hetukañca dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  anidassana appaṭigham sa hetukam ca iva na ca hetum dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ
translated: The visible-with-reacting, the dyad with cause and without cause,

original: naahetuko ceva nanahetu ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na ahetukaḥ ca iva na na hetu ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
